page.title: 16Motorway Systems - Bypass
page.content: Three distinct areas of motorway and bypass meet at Broughton roundabbout. PRESTON BYPASS - M6 OPENED 5th Dec 1958. The first bit of motorway completed in this country, though the south disagrees. M55 to BLACKPOOL - OPENED 3rd July 1975. INGOL DISTRIBUTOR ROAD. Still being built. Sections opened 16th Jan 1984, and 11th June 1984. To be finished June 1986. This bypass has, and is, causing many local arguments over its position, the land it has taken and its use. In our survey we found the motorway nad bypass to be well used for both leisure activities and work. (Leisure - 93%. Work - 25%). People in the area travel to BLACKPOOL, LAKE DISTRICT, SOUTHPORT, BEACON FELL and LANCASTER for a day out.
